list.name: Default
list.comment:
Updates for Adding Records.
Updated LoginController, changed the fielkd names to the user entity.
@GeneratedValue(strategy=GenerationType.AUTO) added to all entities, except M:M relations.
Updated /Login/Register to include additional attributes.
Commented out password check for testing

task.summary: BaseEntity.toTimestamp() updated to include a try / catch block hence eliminating the need for a 'throws ParseException' everywhere it is used.

Could not get mySql to create a 1:1 relationship. Even though the relationship could be created in the ERD , Synchronising the ERD with the DB and then reverse engineering back into an ERD , this would still show a 1:M relationship. I found a workaround ... setting the Many attribute to unique enfgorced the 1:1 relationship required (not ideal), however, when the auto genetration of entities with jpa was performed , the relationships were OneToMant and ManyToOne respectively. The database will not allow the many side, I must make sure the code side takes care of this also, otherwise ugly java errors will result.
Fixed a number of problems attempting to load sample test data into REST. Most self inflicted
Data was loaded via CSV files. csv related - Incorrect number of columns - Incorrect order of columns - Too many FK entries for entries in parent table. - Dates in wrong format, format changed to ciustom format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM'
Rest related; - Rest would fail if FK were defined as int instead of Integer. - Yet the PK must be defined as int.
Json back and managed references swapped between Users and ShoppingCentres to all ShoppingCentre object to pick up Users (= administrator) when the object to retrieved from rest.
json back referenced changed to reflect how the applications will retrieve data. angular entities changed to reflect this also.
All entities updated to include a) retrieval by id. b) returning updated collection back to caller, to refresh their screen, after , create/updatre and/or delete.
All entities updated to include a) retrieval by id. b) returning updated collection back to caller, to refresh their screen, after , create/updatre and/or delete.

Updated LoginController, changed the fielkd names to the user entity.
@GeneratedValue(strategy=GenerationType.AUTO) added to all entities, except M:M relations.
Updated /Login/Register to include additional attributes.

MESSAGE.value: BaseEntity.toTimestamp() updated to include a try / catch block hence eliminating the need for a 'throws ParseException' everywhere it is used.

Could not get mySql to create a 1:1 relationship. Even though the relationship could be created in the ERD , Synchronising the ERD with the DB and then reverse engineering back into an ERD , this would still show a 1:M relationship. I found a workaround ... setting the Many attribute to unique enfgorced the 1:1 relationship required (not ideal), however, when the auto genetration of entities with jpa was performed , the relationships were OneToMant and ManyToOne respectively. The database will not allow the many side, I must make sure the code side takes care of this also, otherwise ugly java errors will result.
Fixed a number of problems attempting to load sample test data into REST. Most self inflicted
Data was loaded via CSV files. csv related - Incorrect number of columns - Incorrect order of columns - Too many FK entries for entries in parent table. - Dates in wrong format, format changed to ciustom format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM'
Rest related; - Rest would fail if FK were defined as int instead of Integer. - Yet the PK must be defined as int.
Json back and managed references swapped between Users and ShoppingCentres to all ShoppingCentre object to pick up Users (= administrator) when the object to retrieved from rest.
json back referenced changed to reflect how the applications will retrieve data. angular entities changed to reflect this also.

ComplexController added
New Controller added to facilitate querying 2 or more entities from the one controller.
Image entity added to test how to save image files to mysql.
All entities updated to include a) retrieval by id. b) returning updated collection back to caller, to refresh their screen, after , create/updatre and/or delete.

Updates for Adding Records.
Updated LoginController, changed the fielkd names to the user entity.
@GeneratedValue(strategy=GenerationType.AUTO) added to all entities, except M:M relations.
Updated /Login/Register to include additional attributes.
